title: The Best Preserved Building -Pride of Garhwal Rifles
review: The Century Old Heritage Mess was built during the British Era and is now being maintained by the Cantonment Board, at about a 15-minute walk from the main market, the Mess stands testament to the times gone by.

title: Spacious and Centrally Located
review: Being from an Army background has it's perks. I got to stay here for 2 days and had a comfortable stay. It sis beautiful and great for people who are into Nature Photography. The view from my room was perfect.

title: Mess in Lansdowne
review: A great mess in Lansdowne known for its culinary delight but surprisingly we were not allowed as the mess is now not open to public.

title: A great and classy place
review: It is extremely sad that it is not open to general public. We just had a peek and the building has an old world charm to it. It is high time that such beautiful buildings are opened for the people to see and enjoy.

title: Accomodation just for Armed forces
review: We stayed id the Building of Sir Roberts , built in 1902.The rooms were huge with a wonderful view. But civilians cannot enter this place.

title: Must see place
review: You can go here courtesy some army connection . But once you go there you see a colonial beauty . Inside you will see many historical artefacts and weapons. Some of the animal trophies are worth admiring . They served us very nice coffe also.
